qas.question: What plays a role in the tension between the Soanghai and the government?

context: Although Mali has enjoyed a reasonably good inter-ethnic relationships based on the long history of <b5_0>coexistence,<b5_0/> some hereditary <a3_0><b6_0>servitude and bondage<a3_0/> relationship<b6_0/> exist, as well as <b7_0>ethnic tension<b7_0/> between settled <a0_0>Songhai and nomadic Tuaregs<a0_0/> of the north. Due to a backlash against the northern population after independence, Mali is now in a situation where both <b8_0>groups complain about <a4_0>discrimination<a4_0/> on the part of the other group<b8_0/>. This conflict also plays a role in the continuing Northern Mali conflict where there is a tension between both Tuaregs and the <a1_0>Malian government<a1_0/>, and the Tuaregs and <a2_0>radical Islamists<a2_0/> who are trying to establish sharia law.
